intro: Pedicularis evrardii var. shanensis, commonly known as the Shan's lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has fleshy, often hairy leaves and produces showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
